title: Liverpool news: Alisson 'taking extra training sessions' to play at Man United
text:
Liverpool goalkeeper Alisson is pushing for a return from injury against Manchester United after the international break.

The Brazilian has undergone extra training sessions at Melwood this week in a bid to shake off the calf injury that has sidelined him since the opening day of the season, according to ESPN.

Alisson went down in the first half of the victory over Norwich in August but has recently returned to light training.

Liverpool goalkeeper Alisson is pushing for a return from injury against Manchester United

The Brazil No 1 suffered a calf injury on the opening weekend of the season against Norwich

Spaniard Adrian has excelled in his absence after joining on a free transfer following his release by West Ham.

The 32-year-old's form has helped Jurgen Klopp's side record a perfect start from their opening eight games of the season, and allowed the club to ease Alisson through his recovery period.

He is now intensifying his efforts to be fit for the trip to Old Trafford on October 20.

Midfielders Adam Lallana and Alex Oxlade-Chamberlain are also believed to have stayed at Melwood this week for extra sessions.
